content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
• No new structures have been successfully created on the map. The agent repeatedly attempted to supply research via a Lab at (0.5, 2.5), but all Lab placement and crafting efforts failed due to missing inventory items and insufficient sub-ingredients. Existing furnace entities were referenced during smelting operations (an iron furnace at (5.0, 5.0) and a copper furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)); however, these were pre‐existing facilities rather than structures built by the agent.

ERROR TIPS
• get_entities() API misuse:
  – Use the correct parameter signature when invoking get_entities(). Avoid unsupported keyword arguments (such as “radius”) and ensure the number of positional arguments matches the API’s requirements.
• Lab placement and retrieval issues:
  – Before attempting Lab placement, verify that a Lab exists in the inventory to prevent “No lab in inventory” errors.
  – When processing the list of Labs, account for cases where the retrieved value might be None (to avoid “NoneType is not iterable” errors).
• Lab crafting resource shortages:
  – Confirm that all required sub-ingredients (for example, iron-gear-wheels, copper-cables, and electronic-circuits) are available before initiating Lab crafting.
  – Strengthen the production chain for prerequisite items to prevent repeated crafting failures due to missing ingredients.
• Resource and inventory management:
  – Monitor resource levels closely to ensure sufficient raw materials and intermediary products are available for both smelting operations and crafting processes.
